multi_ramp module

class multi_ramp.KoradSerial(port, debug=False, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Wrapper for communicating with a programmable KoradSerial KA3xxxxP power supply as a serial interface.

class Serial(port, debug=False, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Serial operations.

There are some quirky things in communication. They go here.

read_character()[source]
read_string(fixed_length=None)[source]

Read a string.

It appears that the KoradSerial PSU returns zero-terminated strings.

str

track(value)[source]

Set tracking mode.

This does nothing on single-channel power supply.

Parameters:

value (Tracking) – Tracking mode to set.

multi_ramp.intensity_ramp(channel, ramp_list, t, device)[source]
Parameters:

  • slope (int or float) – Value for calculated slope of the linear function.

  • y_intercept (int or float) – Value for calculated y-axis intercept of the linear function.

  • calc_current (int or float) – Value for calculated current derived from the linear function for a certain point in time.
